Review_Text: SpoilerMy second documentary film in my Disney+ marathon.I'm not going to judge the old man who decided to stay home, I would have left but I understand him.I'm shocked watching this documentary because the survivors interviewed seem to be happy for the catastrophe.Americans are strange, they didn't even think about the families that were left with nothing.Wow, the surviving cameraman managed to record the moment, I found that very interesting.Good thing the woodcutters survived, some of them.I loved the brothers who tried to save the horses, the best survivors of this catastrophe, as I understand the horses died, right?Conclusion: Sad for the people who didn't survive but sadder for the people who survived and say it was the best moment of their lives, revolting.
Just simply excellent production on surviving the volcano. a must see

Review_title: Such interesting documentary to watch about this event
Review_Text: This documentary was such a interesting & incredible documentary to watch about this event. It gives off so much detail about the 1980 eruption of Mt. St. Helens. Plus once you start watching this documentary your eyes are instantly hook to the screen.It was interesting to to listen to stories of all the survivors of the 1980 eruption of Mt. St. Helens.I love this documentary was so good that I ended up watching it twice and I enjoyed watching this documentary just as much as the first time I watched this documentary about the eruptions 1980 eruption of Mt. St. Helens.
